trans-unit.source: The graphics platform controls the graphics hardware in the device you run your project on. Different devices support different graphics platforms; for example, iOS supports the OpenGL ES graphics platform. You can select which graphics platform your game uses, and add overrides for different platforms (eg Windows, Android, etc).
trans-unit.target: The graphics platform controls the graphics hardware in the device you run your project on. Different devices support different graphics platforms; for example, iOS supports the OpenGL ES graphics platform. You can select which graphics platform your game uses, and add overrides for different platforms (eg Windows, Android, etc).

trans-unit.source: !Warning Moving from Direct3D to an earlier Direct3D version can create problems. For example, if your game contains HDR textures, it will crash, as Direct3D 9 doesn't support them.
trans-unit.target: !Warning Moving from Direct3D to an earlier Direct3D version can create problems. For example, if your game contains HDR textures, it will crash, as Direct3D 9 doesn't support them.

trans-unit.source: You set the graphics platform in the game settings asset.
trans-unit.target: You set the graphics platform in the game settings asset.

trans-unit.source: !Note Make sure you have the latest drivers for the graphics platforms you want to use.
trans-unit.target: !Note Make sure you have the latest drivers for the graphics platforms you want to use.

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View, select the Game Settings asset.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View, select the Game Settings asset.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid, under Rendering Settings > Target graphics platform, select the graphics platform you want to use.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid, under Rendering Settings > Target graphics platform, select the graphics platform you want to use.

trans-unit.source: If you select Default, Stride uses the graphics platform appropriate for your platform (eg Windows, Android) when you build.
trans-unit.target: If you select Default, Stride uses the graphics platform appropriate for your platform (eg Windows, Android) when you build.

trans-unit.source: You can override the graphics platform Stride uses for specific platforms. For example, you can have Linux use Vulkan while other platforms use the default.
trans-unit.target: You can override the graphics platform Stride uses for specific platforms. For example, you can have Linux use Vulkan while other platforms use the default.

trans-unit.source: With the GameSettings asset selected, in the Property Grid, under Overrides, click Green plus button (Add).
trans-unit.target: With the GameSettings asset selected, in the Property Grid, under Overrides, click Green plus button (Add).

trans-unit.source: In the new override, next to Platforms, select the platforms you want this override to apply to.
trans-unit.target: In the new override, next to Platforms, select the platforms you want this override to apply to.

trans-unit.source: In the Configuration drop-down menu, select Rendering Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the Configuration drop-down menu, select Rendering Settings.

trans-unit.source: Under Rendering Settings, in the Preferred Graphics Platform drop-down menu, select the graphics platform you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Under Rendering Settings, in the Preferred Graphics Platform drop-down menu, select the graphics platform you want to use.

trans-unit.source: Stride overrides the graphics platform for the platforms you selected.
trans-unit.target: Stride overrides the graphics platform for the platforms you selected.

trans-unit.source: Check which graphics platform your project uses
trans-unit.target: Check which graphics platform your project uses

trans-unit.source: Add a break point to your game code (eg in a script).
trans-unit.target: Add a break point to your game code (eg in a script).

trans-unit.source: Check the value of the GraphicsDevice.Platform variable.
trans-unit.target: Check the value of the GraphicsDevice.Platform variable.

trans-unit.source: For example, this project is using Vulkan:
trans-unit.target: For example, this project is using Vulkan:
